messages.title: This is a Welsh election and it's your chance to help change our country for the better.
messages.content: Now while also protecting important issues like battling against Assembly and Europe regulations and creating good quality jobs that are more accessible, especially in this time of challenging economic climate across Wales. We have many in Clwyd West, Do the same old tired parties and their worn-out methods really have the answers? Wales needs Plaid in Government, not in opposition. Where other parties try to be London parties ruling from Cardiff, Clwyd West needs a party like Plaid, who puts Wales first and whose heart and roots are here in Wales.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Local schools give a solid start for our children. Libraries are vital for all providing education & leisure for all.
Local Health Centres are important they provide care for young and old.
Post Offices provide necessary services. Pubs are social centres, not cheap supermarket booze. Banks are too serve our people, not big banks for city slickers.
Fighting against Assembly and Europe regulations.

mentions.candidate: Eifion has experience at the highest levels.

issues.economy: Creating good quality jobs which are more accessible.
issues.education: Libraries are vital for all providing education & leisure for all.
issues.governance: Fighting against Assembly and Europe regulations.
issues.health: Local Health Centres - local care, not cuts for young and old

leaflet.personalStatement: Eifion has experience at the highest levels.

politicalExperience.role: Higher Education consultant responsible for developing young Welsh lecturers throughout our universities
Ex-university senior lecturer and head of department
Ex-moderator at universities in Spain & Egypt
Lay inspector of primary & secondary schools
Executive Chair of 2001 National Eisteddfod at Denbigh
Frequent broadcaster on TV & radio for many years
Ex-producer/director & head of HTV in North Wales

leaflet.additionalNotes: Plaid will fight to keep them all.
